outlineItems.title: Run Vault on the HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP)

metadata.title: Vault by HashiCorp
metadata.description: Vault secures, stores, and tightly controls access to tokens, passwords, certificates, API keys, and other secrets in modern computing. Vault handles leasing, key revocation, key rolling, auditing, and provides secrets as a service through a unified API.

packageManagers.label: Ubuntu/Debian
commands: sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install vault

integrationsConfig.description: A curated collection of official, partner, and community Vault plugins.

sidebarLinks.title: Tutorial: Create a custom secrets engine

pageContent.pageSubtitle: Centralize secret management, rotate old credentials, generate credentials on demand, audit client interactions, and support regulatory compliance.

marketingContentBlocks.title: Run Vault on the HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP)

cards.title: Manage static secrets
cards.description: Store, rotate, and encrypt arbitrary strings

cards.title: Manage certificates
cards.description: Integrate with certificate authorities like KMIP and PKI to manage certificate life cycles and authenticate clients

cards.title: Manage identities and authentication
cards.description: Control client access to sensitive information with managed entities, identity tokens, OIDC workflows, and workload identity federation (WIF)

cards.title: Manage 3rd-party secrets
cards.description: Generate and revoke on-demand credentials and control access to external encryption keys and cloud credentials

cards.title: Manage sensitive data
cards.description: Encrypt or tokenize sensitive data in transit and at rest

cards.title: Support regulatory compliance
cards.description: Use Vault as part of an HSM solution, FIPS compliant architecture, or PKCS11 authN workflow
